page.title: 07New Place Farm, Framfield
page.content: In this area is a section of the { {Wealdway,}a footpath from Gravesend to Eastbourne, opened in September, 1981. Much work was needed to restore the paths, putting in stiles, bridges and planning a route. Today the walks are used widely, particularly by the Eastbourne Rambling Club. The main attractions are the grounds and waterfalls of New Place Farm, previously known as Thurston Hall. This was the centre of a mixed farming community which collapsed in 1952 due to an outbreak of foot and mouth disease. The area prospered again with the development of poultry houses owned by Buxted Chicken Company. Hemisphere International now own the farm and have returned it to mixed farming. The labour force includes three local cowmen and two Indian boys hired on two year contracts.
